mdl.calibration¶

Created on Wed Feb 13 15:37:43 2019
@author: Semeon Risom
@email: semeon.risom@gmail.com.
This allows mdl.eyetracking package to initiate calibration/validation/drift correction.
class mdl.calibration.calibration(w, h, tracker, window)[source]¶

This allows mdl.eyetracking package to initiate calibration/validation/drift correction.

Methods

__call__(*args, **kw) Call self as a function.
alert_printf(msg) Print error messages.
clear_cal_display() Clear the calibration display.
draw_cal_target(x, y) Draw the calibration/validation target.
draw_image_line(width, line, totlines, buff) Display image pixel by pixel, line by line.
draw_line(x1, y1, x2, y2, colorindex) Draw a line.
draw_lozenge(x, y, width, height, colorindex) draw a lozenge to show the defined search limits (x,y) is top-left corner of the bounding box.
erase_cal_target() Erase the calibration/validation target.
exit_cal_display() Exits calibration display.
exit_image_display() Clear the camera image.
getColorFromIndex(colorindex) Get color from index.
get_input_key() This function will be constantly pools, update the stimuli here is you need dynamic calibration target.
image_title(text) Display or update Pupil/CR info on image screen.
play_beep(beepid) Play a sound during calibration/drift correction.
record_abort_hide() This function is called if aborted.
set_image_palette(r, g, b) Given a set of RGB colors, create a list of 24bit numbers representing the pallet.
setup_cal_display() Sets up the initial calibration display, which contains a menu with instructions.
setup_image_display(width, height) Set up the camera image, for newer APIs, the size is 384 x 320 pixels.
alert_printf(msg)[source]¶

Print error messages.

clear_cal_display()[source]¶

Clear the calibration display.

draw_cal_target(x, y)[source]¶

Draw the calibration/validation target.

draw_image_line(width, line, totlines, buff)[source]¶

Display image pixel by pixel, line by line.

draw_line(x1, y1, x2, y2, colorindex)[source]¶

Draw a line. This is used for drawing crosshairs/squares.

draw_lozenge(x, y, width, height, colorindex)[source]¶

draw a lozenge to show the defined search limits (x,y) is top-left corner of the bounding box.

erase_cal_target()[source]¶

Erase the calibration/validation target.

exit_cal_display()[source]¶

Exits calibration display.

exit_image_display()[source]¶

Clear the camera image.

getColorFromIndex(colorindex)[source]¶

Get color from index.

get_input_key()[source]¶

This function will be constantly pools, update the stimuli here is you need dynamic calibration target.

image_title(text)[source]¶

Display or update Pupil/CR info on image screen.

play_beep(beepid)[source]¶

Play a sound during calibration/drift correction.

record_abort_hide()[source]¶

This function is called if aborted.

set_image_palette(r, g, b)[source]¶

Given a set of RGB colors, create a list of 24bit numbers representing the pallet. I.e., RGB of (1,64,127) would be saved as 82047, or the number 00000001 01000000 011111111

setup_cal_display()[source]¶

Sets up the initial calibration display, which contains a menu with instructions.

setup_image_display(width, height)[source]¶

Set up the camera image, for newer APIs, the size is 384 x 320 pixels.
